docs.text:
CSV2CSV


Build tool


cd $REPO/tools/cpp/
cmake .
make csv2csv




Usage


Use the 
-h
 flag to learn more about the options csv2csv provides


csv2csv -h




Example


csv2csv -t text.csv -l lang.csv -o output.csv
docs.title: CSV2CSV

docs.text: Use the  -h  flag to learn more about the options csv2csv provides  csv2csv -h
docs.title: Usage

docs.text:
Text Classification using Naive Bayes


Build tool


cd $REPO/tools/cpp/
cmake .
make naivebayes




Usage


Use the 
-h
 flag to learn more about the options 
naivebayes
 provides


naivebayes -h




NOTE: Use the 
csv2csv
 tool to generate a valid csv input file


Example 1


Load input training set and evaluate a sentence


./naivebayes -i input.csv -s "bonjour à tous"




Example 2


Cache the compute Naive Bayes probabilities to a csv file


./naivebayes -i input.csv -c cache.csv




Example 3


Load cached probabilities from file and evaluate a sentence


./naivebayes -l cache.csv -s "bonjour à tous"
docs.title: Naive Bayes

docs.text: Use the  -h  flag to learn more about the options  naivebayes  provides  naivebayes -h  NOTE: Use the  csv2csv  tool to generate a valid csv input file
docs.title: Usage

docs.text: Load input training set and evaluate a sentence  ./naivebayes -i input.csv -s "bonjour à tous"
docs.title: Example 1

docs.text: Cache the compute Naive Bayes probabilities to a csv file  ./naivebayes -i input.csv -c cache.csv
docs.title: Example 2

docs.text: Load cached probabilities from file and evaluate a sentence  ./naivebayes -l cache.csv -s "bonjour à tous"
